text:
Hello Friends,

Hope someone can give some idea where this issue is causing :see_no_evil:.  I created a new theme with custom modules and api's integrations as well. Right now, every time when I installed the theme at domain account , I started to get the error below, on page save. stating that "Redirect Error" etc.

Oh thanks -- I didn't know about developerMode. Just looked it up and that's amazing! Still doesn't help with the "hide on this breakpoint" stuff, but being able to copy a section template is super useful. Thanks :)

Hi Neil, i think you can add those conditions by using the Hubl Variables listed on this page: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/march-2023-rollup#new-hubl-variables-for-detecting-when-a-page-is-viewed-in-an-editor>

<@U05NR1PG32T> Yes, you can only setup one breakpoint. That's not the question on the table here though. When viewing a section or column in the editor, you have (based on that one breakpoint) the option to toggle between desktop and mobile and set padding and such. There's also a "Hide on this breakpoint" toggle. My original question is how to configure a theme template to already have "hide on this breakpoint" enabled for a section or column. No documentation for that. For padding/margin, yes. But that's it.
No, that Looks like normal Template Code that would not cause such an Error to be triggered

Hey everyone. I'm working on a custom theme, and above every template, I have this string.

`ExtensionResource{id=136546621039, portalId=123456, path=vandelay/templates/home.html}`

I feel like there's probably a broken tag somewhere that I'm just not seeing. Has anyone seen this before?

I figured it out if anyone else runs across this.
`{{ template_meta }}` 
was being output where it shouldn't have
Does anyone know how to make a blog page for a theme that doesnâ€™t have blog template available?
Are you using local development tools or the Design manager?
